name: Nursing & health care in the community
desc: Nursing is a healthcare profession, which focuses caring for individuals and their families in order to help them recover from an illness and maintain optimal quality of life. Nursing science is a basic science which deals with the multiple aspects of nursing such as: nurse patient interaction, nursing theories, models, and methodologies

name: Care between hospital and home
desc: This care between hospital and home is provided by our Intermediate Care service and includes teams who will assess and support discharge from hospital, intensive rehabilitation services, both in your home and residential and our occupational health teams who will support you to manage any physical limitations you may have and ensure you can live safely and comfortably once back in your own home.

name: Disability & rehabilitation services
desc: The Disabilities and Rehabilitation unit supports member states in improving rehabilitation within their contexts and in enabling all people with disability to achieve better health.

name: Older people care and support
desc: Caring and helping people lead healthy and fulfilling lives as they become older is a priority and Care Plus Group provide a range of services specifically designed to support older people. These include wellbeing centres, activities and social clubs to address the problem of social isolation.

name: Supported health and wellbeing
desc: The Collaboratives are committed to encourage people to improve their health, well-being and overall lifestyle, enabling them to determine how they wish to live an active life and support them to do so. Our Collaboratives are made up of over 80 dedicated volunteers, supported by a small staff team.With support and training our volunteers are tackling a number of local issues which affect a broad range of health and wellbeing areas. Our volunteers are best placed to find a solution to the issues, test new ideas, implement them and measure their impact.

name: Support finding and staying in employment
desc: Care Plus Group Employability Services offer a variety of free and cost-effective skills and recruitment solutions. Employability Services are a multi-award winning service providing training and recruitment services for businesses across Northern Lincolnshire. Part of the Care Plus Group, we support employers to upskill and ‘grow their own’ workforce via a range of free and cost-effective recruitment initiatives.
